page.title: 14HONLEY HIGH SCHOOL
page.content: A prominent feature of our 'D block' is Honley High School and its grounds. The original school building opened its doors to pupils as{Holme Valley {Grammar School}in September 1932. The building was designed by H. Wormald. In the 1950s it was considerably extended in the original style by the addition of Geography, Biology and Music classrooms, Dining Room and Kitchens. In 1973, when with the introduction of comprehensive education the school became{Honley High,}a vast new complex of modern buildings was added. These included Sports, Music and Art & Craft facilities. The school, which opened with 480 pupils and 14 staff in 1932, has now over 1300 pupils and 80 staff.
